properties.name: American Red Cross
properties.description: The American Red Cross center in Hattiesburg, Miss. was completely destroyed by a tornado that moved through the Pine Belt Area on Sunday afternoon.

properties.name: University of Southern MS
properties.description: The university has declared a state of emergency on campus. According to the USM website, if people are not already on campus, they are advised not to return until further notice.USM is confirming damage to Jazz Station, Mannoni Performing Arts Center, Ogletree Alumni House and Elam Arms.Read more here: http://www.sunherald.com/2013/02/10/4459683/tornado-casuses-damage-in-hattiesburg.html#storylink=cpy#storylink=cpy

properties.name: Damage by county
properties.description: Counties reporting damage include:Forrest County: Numerous homes, businesses and public buildings sustained significant damage; reporting 63 minor injuries.Lamar County: Reports of damage in multiple locations, including Oak Grove and the Lake Serene neighborhood.Reporting 58 homes destroyed and 194 with major damage.Lawrence County: Several homes damaged and minor injuries.Marion County: Several homes damaged and minor injuries.Perry County: Road damageWarren County: Trees down and flooding on multiple streets.Wayne County: Impacts reported in Clara and Progress communities.Yazoo County: Trees down and flooding on multiple streets.
